Key Arguments: The legislation is viewed as an attack on free speech and is described as Orwellian.
The bill is considered a form of censorship, as it would prevent the publication of views that an unelected ACMA disagrees with.
The legislation is seen as contrary to the Declaration of Human Rights.
Australia's multicultural society should allow for diverse worldviews, even if they contradict each other.
Determining 'truth' is complex and beyond the competence of an ACMA committee.
Notable Quotes: The proposed ‘Misinformation’ legislation is a dangerous and Orwellian attack on free speech in Australia and must not become law.
It is itself misinformation for advocates of the bill to claim that it is not censorship.
IT IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE THAT AN UNELECTED ACMA COMMITTEE MIGHT NOW DECLARE ANY OPPOSING VIEWS TO BE MISINFORMATION.
